note: Found 6 mineable channels with verified examples. Challenge: The specific combination of criteria (recent design school grad + SVG animation expertise + AI/vibe coding interest + active in creative communities) is very niche. Most motion designers from SVA/Parsons focus on traditional animation rather than web-based SVG work. Recommend broadening to include adjacent skills or looking at web developers with motion design interest.

channels.name: LinkedIn - SVA/Parsons Recent Motion Design Graduates
channels.description: Recent graduates from top design schools with motion graphics experience
channels.searchQuery: motion designer (SVA OR "School of Visual Arts" OR Parsons) 2024 2025 graduate

example.name: Hyojin Shim
example.description: 3D Animator/Motion graphic designer, SVA Class of 2024. Portfolio showcases motion design work with passion for crafting visuals that bring warmth and heart. Currently open to work. Contact: hshim0003@gmail.com. Instagram: @hyojin_lab

channels.reason: Recent SVA graduate actively seeking work with strong portfolio. Focus is 3D/motion graphics rather than specifically SVG, but demonstrates technical skill and passion for motion design.

channels.name: LinkedIn - Parsons Communication Design Recent Graduates
channels.description: Multidisciplinary designers from Parsons with motion graphics and UX/visual design skills
channels.searchQuery: Parsons Communication Design 2025 graduate motion designer

example.name: Rice Gallardo
example.description: UX & Visual Designer with MPS Communication Design from Parsons '25. Multidisciplinary artist working across UX/UI, motion, graphic design, illustration. Based in NYC. Portfolio showcases inclusive design work with empathy-first approach.

channels.reason: Very recent graduate (2025) with motion design skills. Multidisciplinary approach suggests adaptability. Portfolio shows strong design sense though focus is broader than pure motion/SVG work.

channels.name: Instagram - SVA Motion Graphics Program
channels.description: Official SVA motion graphics program showcasing student work and recent graduates

example.name: SVA Motion Graphics (@svamotion)
example.description: Motion design projects from School of Visual Arts Design Department. Features student work, graduate showcases, and connects to individual student portfolios. Active community of motion designers.

channels.reason: High concentration of recent motion design graduates. Direct pipeline to SVA talent. Can browse posts to find individual students' portfolios and contact information.

channels.name: CodePen - SVG Animation Portfolios
channels.description: Developers and designers showcasing SVG animation work with live code examples

example.name: Aniboaz (@Aniboaz)
example.description: Designer specializing in SVG animations for portfolios. CodePen work demonstrates technical SVG animation skills without JavaScript. Also has portfolio on Devpost (devpost.com/aniboaz).

channels.reason: Strong SVG animation skills demonstrated in code. Technical curiosity evident from CodePen presence. However, unclear if recent graduate or seeking immediate freelance work.

channels.name: GitHub - Framer Motion Portfolio Developers
channels.description: Developers building animated portfolios with modern motion libraries (adjacent to SVG animation)

example.name: Gideon1107
example.description: Software engineer with 2025 portfolio built using React, Tailwind CSS, and Framer Motion. Demonstrates modern animation techniques, responsive design, interactive particle backgrounds. Shows technical curiosity and current tech stack knowledge.

channels.reason: Recent work (2025) with animation expertise using modern libraries. Technical curiosity demonstrated. However, appears more developer-focused than designer, and not specifically from target schools.

channels.name: Personal Blog - Creative Coders with P5.js/Motion Focus
channels.description: Technical creatives writing about motion animation and creative coding
channels.searchQuery: p5.js motion animation portfolio creative coding 2024 2025

example.name: Ryosuke Hana (@whoisryosuke)
example.description: Creative coder at PlayStation prototyping new experiences. Active blogger about p5.js, Motion animations, and creative coding. Recent posts on integrating Motion.js with P5.js (2025). GitHub: github.com/whoisryosuke. Demonstrates deep technical curiosity.

channels.reason: Strong technical skills and passion for creative coding/motion work. Active in community. However, currently employed at PlayStation (not available for immediate freelance) and not a recent graduate.

challenges_encountered: Twitter/X search results were largely inaccessible due to JavaScript requirements
Very few candidates found who specifically combine: recent graduate + design school + SVG animation + AI/vibe coding interest
Most motion designers focus on video/3D animation rather than web-based SVG work
Creative coding community members tend to be developers rather than design school graduates
recommended_adjustments: Consider web developers with strong motion design interest (rather than only motion designers)
Broaden animation skills to include Framer Motion, GSAP, Three.js (not just SVG)
Look at bootcamp graduates or self-taught developers in addition to design school grads
Focus on 'technical curiosity' and 'passion for craft' as primary filters rather than specific school credentials

other_promising_channels.name: OpenProcessing Community
other_promising_channels.note: 100k+ creative coders sharing projects. Need to browse manually to find recent graduates.

other_promising_channels.name: P5.js Showcase
other_promising_channels.note: International community of p5.js creators. Good source for creative coders with motion design skills.

other_promising_channels.name: Motion Designers Discord
other_promising_channels.note: 1,392 members. Community-based sourcing possible but requires active engagement.

other_promising_channels.name: SVA Shows 2025
other_promising_channels.note: Upcoming graduate exhibitions (Animation Celebration May 16, 2025). Direct access to Class of 2025 thesis work.
